questions.question: What is the supreme law of the land?
What do we call the first ten amendments to the Constitution?
Who is known as the 'Father of the Constitution'?
How many amendments does the Constitution have?
Which amendment abolished slavery in the United States?
Which amendment granted women the right to vote?
Who has the power to declare war according to the Constitution?
What is the main purpose of the Constitution?
Which branch of government is responsible for making federal laws?
What does the Fifth Amendment protect against?
What are the first three words of the Constitution?
How many justices are on the Supreme Court?
Which amendment established the income tax?
What is the veto power?
options: The President's power to reject a bill
The Congress's power to amend laws
The Supreme Court's power to interpret laws
The power of the states to nullify federal laws
questions.correctAnswer: The President's power to reject a bill

questions.question: What does the term 'due process' refer to?
options: Fair treatment through the normal judicial system
The right to a speedy trial
The right to a public trial
questions.correctAnswer: Fair treatment through the normal judicial system

questions.question: Which amendment prohibits cruel and unusual punishment?
